column4: hi mysql server crashed...  its far server... i decided to restart ubuntu. i afraid for cant connect to server by ssh if it gets error on restarting.... i must i do? restart or not?
You almost certainly do not need to restart the operating system. Have you diagnosed the problem mysql had that caused it to crash? Have you tried to restart mysqld?
yeah... i couldnt stop, remove, reinstall mysql server...
okay... what?! O_o Why do you need to remove or reinstall mysql server? I thought it crashed and now you want to restart it.
somethings went wrong when i tried to install iredmail... then i couldnt stop, start, remove or reinstall mysql server...
do you have an idea?
okay, show me what happens when you try to restart mysqld.
^Mike\b,
just a minute...
Stopping MySQL database server: mysqld.
Stopping MySQL database server: mysqld.
put it in a pastebin please

Also, you probably can't start mysqld as any user other than root or mysql. Try `sudo service mysql restart`
